result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allessandra M. Sylvesteri

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 9:02 AM: 22CF360, 22CF900.
Defendant Allessandra M. Sylvesteri in court with Attorney George E. Miller.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) as part of a 3 Year DAGP. 
DAGP may term after 2 Years if restitution is paid in full and the DAGP Coordinator approves.
Defendant is ordered to complete 60 Hours of Community Service as part of the DAGP. Court withholds finding of guilt.
Charge to be dismissed upon successful completion of the DAGP. 
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Conditions: 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

11:15 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allessandra M. Sylvesteri in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Allessandra M. Sylvesteri. 
Waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 8-15-22 at 2:00 PM. 
Return to court: 8-19-22 at 9:00 AM in Branch 4.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
